@GameOverRos the frequent elitism shown by upperclass male university students in MFMM at THE uni (i.e. Melb) is quite accurate. Still.
@GameOverRos there's one shot that I'm fairly certain is the Vic Supreme Court with all the court signs covered up.
@GameOverRos Miss Fisher's house is in Parkville, not St Kilda. I cannot figure out where City South Police Station is IRL.
@GameOverRos the offices of Women's Monthly in Away With The Fairies (S1) is Vic Trades Hall @VicUnions
@GameOverRos the gentleman's club in Murder Most Scandalous is actually the rear entrance of @VicParliament
@GameOverRos I love the locations - watching The Blood of Juana the Mad now (one with medical students.) This is shot at @unimelb
@GameOverRos can't remember which one that is https://t.co/BJ7JkGSYMP
@GameOverRos Yep! It's pretty clear by halfway through S1 that Cec + Burt are in for a penny, in for a pound because life is never dull
@GameOverRos Yes. Phryne learns to respect the more demure ladies in the world, Dottie learns to stand up for herself and open her horizons
@GameOverRos very last episode, where Phryne is flying her dad back to England, Jack drives out then runs up to the plane and they snog
@GameOverRos they gradually stop protesting working for The Man (even if The Man is The Lady) and go along with Miss P's antics.
@GameOverRos if you go back and watch the first episode, Cec + Burt pick up Miss Fisher as a taxi client and she continues to employ them
@GameOverRos trying to remember the order... have you seen the season where Phryne's Dad comes back to Melbourne and gets in strife?
@GameOverRos Cersei's reaction to wildfire when burning the Tower of the Hand makes me think Book C would use logic of Show C re battle
@GameOverRos ready for married life - moving out of Miss P's house, not working anymore, being restrained and demure and all that
@GameOverRos I love that Dottie gets slowly more and more feminist. Culminates in some brilliant stuff in S3 when Hugh pushes her to get
@GameOverRos I know the stuff in S1 with Cec and Burt and their "red ragging" Commie buddies is on point - Nan and Pop were Commies :)
@GameOverRos so then we have Dany the Mad Queen, Cersei killed for blowing up part of city too, and KL off the map, prob Dorne too
@GameOverRos Dany arrives, doesn't believe that Aegon is legit, brings dragonfire to Dance and inadvertantly ignites her father's WF caches
@GameOverRos Cersei flees to Casterly Rock. (Jaime meets her there and gets strangly.) Aegon takes city, with Dornish + Arianne as bride.
@GameOverRos Myrcella dies earlier in botched 'rescue' attempt as per Cersei's plans that Balon Swann thinks about
@GameOverRos when Jaime finds out, this is what pushes him to valonquar. Tommen either dies in wildfire or at hands of FrankenGregor
@GameOverRos yep. I think: Aegon storms KL. Cersei attempts to use wildfire in defence of Tommen, kills large portion of smallfolk
@GameOverRos Have you seen the most recent season (S3)? THEY KISS AND OMG IT IS GLORIOUS

@GameOverRos to driving... and Phryne's reaction.

@GameOverRos from my limited knowledge of pre-war Aus history, yes? Love the stuff like moron who thinks women are "biologically unsuited"
But the US President is sacking the acting A-G for DOING HER DAMN JOB and telling him that his policies are unlawful.
And the A-G was condemned for his part, and has been shuffled off to an ambassadorial post (because as if #auspol does responsible govt LOL)
Let's put all this in context. In Aus, the Solicitor-General (Justin Gleeson SC) resigned because the Attorney-General acted above the law
@GameOverRos cannot stop laughing at Hugh's emotional "I've burned my footy scarf sir!" So typical of the stupidity of the average Melb man!
@GameOverRos for AFL though. Not for proper bloody football. A League has to struggle against not very thinly veiled racism - "wogball"

"What's awkward compared to dying in the shower hung by the opposition's scarf?"
Phryne putting things in perspective, as always :)
@bethrajohnston yikes. Maybe tell her that you're not in a headspace yourself for visitors? Would she respect that?

"So? I'll just divide them up... girls for the West, boys for Abbotsford." "It's people like you that bring footy clubs down Dottie!"
I also adore this scene: "If Hugh marries me, I don't see why I should convert." "Because he'll want to take his kids to the footy!"
